laws.summary: Iowa does not have a statewide law prohibiting employers from asking applicants about salary history.
requirements: Employers may legally ask about prior salary
Use of salary history may increase discrimination risk under federal law
Best practice is to avoid salary history inquiries
laws.notes: While legal in Iowa, many employers avoid salary history questions to reduce risk under Title VII and Equal Pay Act.

laws.summary: Iowa does not require employers to disclose wage ranges in job postings or offer letters.
laws.statute_citation: No current statute mandating pay transparency
requirements: Wage range disclosure is not legally required
Employers may voluntarily disclose compensation information
Federal equal pay and anti-discrimination laws still apply
laws.notes: Some multi-state employers disclose pay ranges to comply with other state laws.

laws.summary: Non-compete agreements are generally enforceable in Iowa if reasonable in scope, duration, and geography and if they protect legitimate business interests.
requirements: Must protect legitimate business interests
Must be reasonable in duration
Must be reasonable in geographic scope
Cannot impose undue hardship on employee
Overly broad restrictions may be invalidated by courts
laws.notes: Iowa courts evaluate restrictive covenants under a reasonableness test.

laws.summary: Iowa does not have a statewide ban-the-box law for private employers, but federal FCRA requirements apply when using background check vendors.
requirements: Written consent required before third-party background checks
Must provide pre-adverse action notice before taking negative action
Must provide copy of report and summary of rights
Must issue adverse action notice if decision is finalized
Criminal history use must be non-discriminatory
laws.notes: Applies whenever a consumer reporting agency is used.

laws.summary: Iowa does not mandate paid sick leave statewide but protects certain civic leave rights.
requirements: Employers must allow employees to attend jury duty
Employers cannot penalize employees for jury service
Employees must be allowed unpaid time to vote if their schedule does not permit voting outside work hours
No statewide paid sick leave requirement
laws.notes: Offer letters should not contradict statutory civic leave protections.

laws.summary: Iowa permits workplace drug testing and does not provide employment protections for recreational cannabis use.
requirements: Employers may conduct drug testing under a written policy
Drug testing must follow statutory procedures
Employers may discipline or refuse to hire based on positive marijuana tests
Cannabis is not protected for employment purposes
laws.notes: Iowa has specific procedural rules for employer drug testing programs.

laws.summary: Arbitration agreements are generally enforceable in Iowa if consistent with contract law and federal arbitration principles.
laws.statute_citation: Federal Arbitration Act; Iowa Uniform Arbitration Act
requirements: Agreement must be clear and voluntary
Must not be unconscionable
Must provide reasonable notice
Courts may invalidate overly one-sided clauses
laws.notes: Fairness and clarity are key to enforceability.

laws.summary: Iowa follows the at-will employment doctrine, subject to statutory, contractual, and public policy exceptions.
requirements: Employment is presumed at-will unless contract provides otherwise
Cannot terminate for discriminatory reasons
Cannot retaliate for protected activity
Public policy exceptions apply
Employee handbooks can create implied contractual obligations
laws.notes: Clear at-will language in offer letters is recommended.

laws.summary: Iowa law prohibits discrimination in employment based on protected characteristics.
requirements: Cannot discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity
Cannot discriminate based on national origin or ancestry
Cannot discriminate based on disability
Cannot discriminate based on age (18+ under Iowa law)
Harassment is prohibited
Retaliation for protected activity is prohibited
laws.notes: Iowa protects sexual orientation and gender identity explicitly under state law.

data_quality.sources: Iowa Division of Labor, Iowa Code, Iowa Civil Rights Commission, official state guidance
data_quality.coverage_completeness: comprehensive for offer-letter and hiring compliance

additional_notes.general_guidance: Iowa is generally employer-friendly but has specific statutory procedures for drug testing and strong civil rights protections.
recent_developments: No statewide pay transparency law enacted as of 2026
No statewide paid sick leave mandate
Statutory procedures continue to govern employer drug testing
